statement.p: Suppose that of n_1={{n}}\, {{sample1}}, x_1={{x1}}\, {{success1}} and of n_2={{n}}\, {{sample2}}, x_2={{x2}}\, {{success1}}. Test the hypothesis that the difference between the proportion of {{population1}} who {{success2}}: p_1, and the proportion of {{population2}} who {{success2}}: p_2, {{ineq}}\, {{prefix}}0.0{{p0dec}}. That is p_1-p_2\{{ineqsymb}}{{prefix}}0.0{{p0dec}}

ol.li: Using complete sentences, state the meaning of the p-value in the context of this problem.

ul.li: The null hypothesis is H_0: p_1-p_2={{prefix}}0.0{{p0dec}}.
The sampling distribution has mean {{prefix}}0.0{{p0dec}} and standard error SE={{SE}}.
The difference in sample proportions is \hat{p}={{phat}} which has z-score z={{zscore}}.
